Class RidgeNoise

This generator adds samples with weight decreasing with frequency, like Perlin settings; however, each signal is taken as absolute value, and weighted by previous (i.e. lower-frequency) signal, creating a sort of feedback loop. Resulting settings has sharp ridges, somewhat resembling cliffs. This is useful for terrain generation.

RidgeNoise(Generator)

Create new ridge generator with user-supplied source. Usually one would use this with ValueNoise or gradient settings with less dimensions, but some weird effects may be achieved with other generators.

Properties

| Improve this Doc View Source

Exponent

Exponent defines how fast weights decrease with frequency. The higher the exponent, the less weight is given to high frequencies. Default value is 1

Declaration
public float Exponent { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Single
| Improve this Doc View Source

Gain

Gain is the weight factor for previous-step signal. Higher gain means more feedback and noisier ridges. Default value is 2.

Declaration
public float Gain { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Single
| Improve this Doc View Source

Offset

Offset is applied to signal at every step. Default value is 1

Declaration
public float Offset { get; set; }

OnParamsChanged()

This method is called whenever any generator's parameter is changed (i.e. Lacunarity, Frequency or OctaveCount). Override it to precalculate any values used in generation.
